Reviews.Title: “Affordable, spacious, well equipped in great location”
Reviews.Author: LWCLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Somerset Liang Court and the 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom apartment we had was terrific value for money with all the amenities one could wish for from Flat Screen TV's to a large fridge, washing machine, microwave etc. The large walk in shower was particularly welcome after the usual over bath showers one gets in most hotels that are double the price. The breakfasts were a bit chaotic but the accommodation was very good. The pool was lovely and never crowded. Free, good quality wireless too. Located next door to Clarke Quay and a very good small shopping centre was ideal for our family. Overall very little to fault besides the battered old bathroom door that was totally incongruous in what was otherwise very well appointed accommodation. Highly recommended nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan E
Reviews.Content: I agree with the positive things that have been said about this place - very nice staff - good pool (shared with the Novotel Hotel next door but never very crowded), small buffet breakfast included - interesting mix of East/West choices. We are relocating to Singapore and my husband is already living there - my 2 children and I stayed here for a couple of weeks over Easter and will return when we move over permanently - we will be there for 6 weeks while we look for an apartment. Only downer is that the daily maid service is a little haphazard in some respects. The location is great for transport and local interest within walking distance (Clarke Quay, Chinatown, Fort Canning Park) but very touristy area which makes it a little noisy at night and expensive to eat out (go to the Kopitiam Food Court in the mall like the locals do for good cheap eats )

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Families”
Reviews.Author: si26
Reviews.Content: We chose Somerset Liang Court after reading the reviews and also because we were a family of 4 and needed a two bedroom apartment. The apartment was very spacious, clean and my children (9 & 12) had enough space to themselves. The kitchen was well equipped with the basics. The food court, other eateries and the supermarket in Liang Court shopping center is a blessing as it solves the problem of daily meals . The choices are varied to suit everyones taste. The pool is also nice and big and the kids had fun splashing around. The location is also very central with Clarke Quay, shopping district and tourist attractions close by. On the whole we had a very pleasant stay and would go back when in Singapore again. I had read the reviews about the poor breakfast and must add a few points to them . The restaurant is not at all equipped to handle the number of guests staying in the hotel. There are not enough tables and chairs, very poor selection of food and the dishes are not replenished fast enough. Somerset Liang Court should consider making the breakfast optional as we only tried it for 1 day in our 10 day trip. The kitchenette in the apartments is sufficient for mornings. The price of the rooms would be less if the breakfast is made optional. But having said that on the whole we had a very pleasant stay and would stay in Somerset again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: 200Elsa
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful alternative to two hotel rooms and much cheaper. Very pleasant service from all the staff we met on our a two-night stay in this Hotel. The location was really convenient for the MRT,and 15 minute walking distance to Funan and Raffles City. The breakfast was perfectly adequate and the free wi-fi access was a real bonus for keeping in touch with family and friends. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Service apartment for families”
Reviews.Author: antartoo
Reviews.Content: There is a kitchen, living room, dinning room & table, two bedrooms and two bathrooms, good for travelling with families. Staff are very polite and helpful. Not many options with the breakfast, but it's acceptable. Located next to a shopping mall, with a supermarket, fast foods and a food court.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious change”
Reviews.Author: NiceMartin
Reviews.Content: A fully-equipped modern two-bedroom apartment, breakfast included, is available here for the price of a double room in a top hotel. No restaurant, but a good kitchen and dining area in the apartment, and of course all the bars, clubs, cafes and restaurants a minute away along Clarke Quay and beyond that Boat Quay. Very pleasant service from all the staff we met on a two-night stay, from reception to chambermaid and breakfast room. One criticism: breakfast was spoiled by the crowds in the inadequate lounge set aside for it. Otherwise, a good choice for a family or for anyone wanting space over service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Arlyn_H
Reviews.Content: My two adult sons and I recently spent eight days in a two-bedroom apartment at Somerset Liang Court. The location was really convenient for the MRT, restaurants at Clarke Quay, shopping in the attached Liang Court shopping centre, and an easy 15 minute walking distance to Funan and Raffles City. My sons enjoyed jogging along the river in the morning and returning for a swim in the pool which was never busy. The apartment was a peaceful haven to return to after a busy day out and about with plenty of space to relax, and the washer/dryer was really convenient as we travel light which means washing clothing more often. The staff were very friendly and attentive and always happy to answer any queries. The breakfast was perfectly adequate and the free wi-fi access was a real bonus for keeping in touch with family and friends.The only downside is the construction of a new MRT station adjacent to Liang Court and the noise which started early in the morning but as there always seems to be construction going on somewhere in Singapore it is hard to avoid. And as we were out and about all day it wasn't too much of a problem. This was a wonderful alternative to two hotel rooms and much cheaper. I would certainly recommend Somerset Liang Court.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: Gavin W
Reviews.Content: If you have a young family and are considering spending at least a week in Singapore then I would wholely recommend staying in Somerset Liang. We were in a 2-bed premier apartment on the 9th floor (#9-01) and it was spacious, clean and well-furnished to a very high standard. The children's room and bathroom was great (especially the shower which we used as opposed to the one in the en-suite) and our room was very large, plenty of wardrobe space and the bed was absolutely fantastic. The free wi-fi is a real bonus for the whole family. There aren't many serviced apartments which include breakfast and reading previous negative reviews I didn't have great expectations but, whilst ilst it wouldn't win 2AA rosettes, it was perfectly adequate, plenty of variety and kept us all going for most of the day. The pool was clean, warm and there weren't many people using it. The staff are remarkably helpful, always smiling and responded to our requests immediately Location is excellent, MRT close by and taxi's very cheap. We love Singapore and it is highly likely that we will return to these apartments. Only negative, though it's not Somerset Liangs fault, is that there was construction going on outside our window. The premier 2-bed apartments seem to be on each corner of the building and the view outside of our apartment was the least inspiring but if you get a River view or one out onto Fort Canning Park then you probably won't be affected by this noise Enjoy your time

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great accommodation, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: meloddica
Reviews.Content: Very comfy and spacious apartment, clean, has all appliances needed, ideal for long stays, location is perfect right next to river side (clarke quay) close to malls, restaurants and nightlife, as well walking distance from metro station, taxi and bus stops. The hotel is very safe and staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the 8th floor pool was nice. The only bad side was the breakfast, it had very limited options.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liang Court for almost 2 weeks with 2 couples sharing a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment. The apartment itself was excellent and the decor was clean and modern. There was so much space in there, and it was designed so the 2nd bed/bath could be shut off from the main apartment for privacy. A lot of people we met while in Singapore, or friends who have travelled to Singapore, quite often whinged about the lack of space in their hotel room. This is definitely a room to spread out and relax in comfort. As part of the accomodation package, we recieved complimentary buffet breakfast in the dining room every morning, which had all the basic hot/cold foods to pick from. We also recieved free wireless internet which was fabulous considering phone carriers charge a fortune for overseas data usage. The location was superb, right next door to Liang Court shopping centre, down the road from Clarke Quay eating district (so many fabulous restaurants to pick from!!) and short walk to train station. The staff were always SUPER friendly and helpful and we all loved how they said good morning and hoped we had a good day everytime we walked past. Lovely holiday in a lovely apartment hotel. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, really good location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Melb_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a week. Chose hotel because of it's location and inclusion of breakfast as part of package. Booked a two-bedroom apartment. Location is great. Located on top of the Liang Court shopping centre and right next door to Clarke Quay entertainment district - a short walk from MRT station. Service from staff was fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble at all. Had a few requests during our week stay and all were attended to very promptly. 2 bedroom apartment is very large and spacious. One king bed in main room with ensuite and twin beds in second room with main bathroom located next to it. Full size kitchen with dining table and a european laundry. My only criticism of the rooms is that the beds were uncomfortable. Mattresses are really too hard and after a couple of nights, sleeping on them started to become a problem. The pillows on the other hand were incredibly soft and didn't provide much head/neck support. Breakfast was a bit of a hit and miss affair, especially with the hot food choices that had some interesting combinations - such as waffles with broccili and cauliflower on the side? But overall was adequate. I think with improvement to mattresses and the breakfast bar, the Somerset Liang Court would be a great place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great spacious apartments, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: SueEllen_11
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the Liang Court in December 2011 for 10 nights. We had the 2-bedroom apartment on the 22th floor with windows to Clarke Quay. The view was spectacular but naturally it also meant that the party noice from the Quay was there (it was bearable though). Liang Court shopping centre is right under where you can buy Starbuck's coffee, Meiya supermarket, McDonalds, Subway, foodcourt.... No need to make your own suppers in the apartment kitchen.... The washing&drying machine was a great benefit for us with 2 kids. The staff was very helpful, smiling and greeting warmly. Cleaner did a good job and was very nice person. The apartment was very good, with plenty of space for the whole family and occasional visitors. Master bedroom had 180cm bed and a private bathroom. More luxurious than at home. I recommend Somerset Liang Court warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a busines trip”
Reviews.Author: chuckyc119
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one month and it was fine. The subway was very close, the supermarket was right next door and there are many bars are in the area. The room itself was fine with a tv, kitchen, fridge, washing machine, desk, dining table, also ironing board and clothes drying rack. The beds are comfortable, but the bathroom was small and could be better ventilated. The air con and wifi was always great. I would stay here again but I would try another Somerset property first because this property was an older property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller123345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks during christmas and really liked the place. The location is great and the renovated rooms are spacious and comfortable. Noise from the street can be a problem, especially if your room is on the south side of the building, especially as the party at neighbouring Clarke Quay will go on until late in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Makgomo1
Reviews.Content: Such a great location with a supermarket, Starbucks, restaurants and a brilliant toddlers play gym right in Liang Court. We stayed at this apartment for 10 months and love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with young kids.”
Reviews.Author: JackyKero
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 10 days with our 2 kids, aged 5 and 7, in a 2 bedrooms apartment. This was perfect for us for many reasons: 1. The 2 bedroom apartment provides parents with some privacy, allows putting the kids to bed first, and adds the comfort of the extra living space (living / dining room is quite large). The kitchen is sparsely equipped, to an equivalent level of what you'd expect an extended stay hotel to provide in th US or Europe (plus the rice cooker :-) 2. The apartments are equipped with a washing-drying machine, drying clothesline, ironing board and iron. You will need to change your clothes frequently in this hot and humid weather. Unless you travel heavy, you'll have to wash 3. The swimming pool. Not for toddlers (it starts at 1 meter), but great for kids, and parents who want a swim or linger in the sun. Never crowded and very quiet. The kids could not have enough of it. 4. The transportation options. The Clarque Quay subway station is a 5-10 minutes walk away, there a bus stations all around the hotel, and a taxi station as well. 5. The location. The Quays are behind the hotel, for a great evening walk either in the Clarque Quay complex or more quietly by the river banks. Under the hotel are a grocery shop and 2 food courts (a Kopitiam and a smaller Japanese court by the grocery shop). 6. The continental breakfast, not the most incredible hotel breakfast you'll ever have, but very decent. We did not get bored of it in 10 days. Our conclusion - We would go back there, definitely

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: schueyrocks
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in two of their two bedroom apartments for a week. Location is great - attached to Liang Court Mall right next to Clarke Quay. The apartments were spacious and had all amenities like washing machine and cookware to make our stay comfortable. The balconies in the apartment looked out over the river and Clarke Quay. However, the best thing about Somerset Liang Court is their staff - all their staff are always smiling and helpful. They really converted a good stay to a fantastic one! There was some renovation work happening in the lobby but that did not affect our stay. There was also a planned power outage one night which was handled very well by their staff. Overall, I would highly recommend a stay here and would definitely return when I am in Singapore next.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, personal service”
Reviews.Author: volkia
Reviews.Content: Had my daughter's first birthday there, they just picked up on it when I had a cake delivered, and that evening delivered a cake to my door!! Great friendly service, even when they are so busy at the desk they accommodate you very well. Cleaners are amazing, they do their work very well and even wash your dishes! and you can suggest what days are best for you. Location is very convenient, with liang court mall and plenty of restaurants nearby. Overall highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “warmth and friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: lobo l
Reviews.Content: we have a wonderful and enjoyable time in Singapore. we stayed in Somerset Liang Court, and it was tremendous. the staffs were great. the front office, security and the housekeeping were very helpful, courteous and friendly. upon check in you can feel the warmness of the staffs. and the apartment we stayed was nice and spacious, suited for families who wants to come for a holiday. i can't wait to come back again and stay in Somerset Liang Court. All the best, cheers

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: N W
Reviews.Content: somerset liang court is truly one of the nice n decent place i have stayed in during my business trip. i must say, that the service from the front office staffs, the housekeeping staffs and even the guard had provided were tremendous. all of them were friendly and made my family felt at home when i was away at the office. i do not understand about why Mr. Bob B is so mad about. you can judge by looking at all the other reviews from the start, and most of them were reasonably good comments. and all of a sudden, one bad, or i would say the worst comment that Mr. Bob B have commented, i strongly have to disagree with his reviews. judging by his comments, i doubt he had stayed in Somerset Liang Court. probably he must been mistaken by the motels or hotels he had checked in with hookers. well, anyway...Somerset Liang Court staffs, you made my stay awesome, thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jack_twoandthree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liang Court for 9 nights in July. The accomodation was of an excellent standard and perfect when travelling with young children and family. We had booked 2 apartments and they were able to put us next door to eachother by providing an upgrade to one of the bookings. Our rooms were on the 22nd floor and over looked the Singapore river and Marina Bay - great view. The staff were very accomodating (providing an extra cot) and gave very good information (eg best buses to catch). The pool was excellent and although it got busy at times it never felt over-crowded. The location was ideal, close to everything and it was great to wonder through Clarke Quay in the evenings. We would definittly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: whatthe111111
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Somerset Liang Court in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment on the 21st floor and was very happy with our choice The apartment was spacious, clean, well equipped and cetainly big enough for a family of four. As already mentioned in previous posts it's in a great location, 3 minute walk to Clarke Quay, supermarket next door, taxi ramp out front and friendly staff. Breakfast was more than adequate with a good variety of food to choose from. Didn't use the pool area but it looked okay. Lots to do in Singapore and we found catching taxis easy, quick and cheap especially in the heat. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Andy&suey
Reviews.Content: You must book 7 days or more to stay here - I booked a two bedroom suite for four friends , very clean , great location . breakfast is included but we just ended up making toast in the room most days . Washer and dryer in the kitchen saves a lot of hassle tring to get clothes cleaned although if you go to the basement/carpark - you can go to the supermarket right in the complex and there is also a laundry service there. it is also quite near the MRT. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: yeoinus
Reviews.Content: We chose Somerset Liang Court because the property offered 2 bedroom - 2 bath plus a basic breakfast - for the same or lower price for 2 rooms, quoted by certain hotels. Pluses for Liang Court were the living room which was useful for entertaining the occasional guests, washer/dryer which worked adequately enough, walking distance to MRT station and food court and supermarket on the ground floor. On one of the nights, however, there was a power shutdown due to some maintenance work and we were offered an alternative apartment at a sister property in Cairnhill Road. The apartment there was more spacious but somehow we preferred the cosiness of our Liang Court apartment. One good point about the Cairnhill property though was its breakfast room which had a better layout and looked more welcoming than that at Liang Court.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Shopper18
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sommerset Liang Court before (April 2010), and were so impressed that we booked another 10 night stay for our 2011 holiday. We have stayed in many establishments over the years, but I can honestly say that this one ourshines them all. First off, the staff are amazing. Regardless of how busy they are, they will always go out of their way to help. Secondly, the standard of accomodation for the price is brilliant. All of the apartments have been recently refurburished to a very high standard and are well kept and spacious. Thirdly the facilities are great! We spent a lot of time at the swimming pool which is just beautiful (and a welcome relief from the heat.) Breakfasts are included in the accomodation price, however we did not feel the need to make use of this service as the apartments are right next to a great shopping centre with a large food court. Fourthly the location is great. The adjoining shopping centre has a supermarket below, full food court and some great shops (check out the book shop if you have time!) There are many riverside restaurants which are only walking distance away, and there is a taxi stand right outside the shopping centre to take you other key shopping / eating areas (the taxi fare to Orchard Rd is only a couple of SGD dollars.) Will be back to stay at Sommerset Liang Court in 2012!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1 word....WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadeblevens
Reviews.Content: Location location location!!! This place has everything you could ever need!! There was 4 adults (my mom and grandmother) and 1 child. We stayed in the 2 bedroom serviced apartment for 1 week and it was PERFECT!!! Not only was the apartment clean, new, nice and comfortable the kitchen was great and the washer and dryer was a nice touch! The location couldn't be better, right on Clarke Quay where there is an abundance of restaurants and shops and a short walk to the MRT station. Just downstairs is a money changer, huge amazing grocery store, 7-11, Starbucks, McDonalds and 2 taxi stands. There is also an indoor kids play area in the mall downstairs. The pool was great, nice and cold and the food at the pool was great. There is also a HUGE park right across the street, great for walks! I also had to work while I was on vacation and the wifi was amazing and I had no issues at all. I highly recommend this place for families and it was great for my 3 year old son as there was LOTS that we could walk to. I dont think I will ever stay anywhere else when I visit Singapore. This place had it all and more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: 999mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 1 week with our 2 kids, age 10 and 13. We love staying in the apartment - it is so much better than a hotel room! The bedrooms and bathrooms were very nice and just big enough. The kitchen is small, but it had everything we needed. The internet access was good as was the TV/Stereo. The apartment was very clean. The breakfast always offered plenty of choices and variety. The pool is huge and beautiful. The location was excellent. Plenty of food choices nearby, including a food court, 7-11 and grocery in the building. Clarke Quay has numerous restaurants and bars as well. It is a short walk to the MRT station and there is a taxi stand right downstairs, so it is easy to get to other places in Singapore and easy to get back! I would highly recommend staying here, especially with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bennystar131
Reviews.Content: I stay only 2 nights but the stay was very conmfortable and relaxed. I wish i could stayed longer. . the views were wow on high floor. swimming pool was large. . i did not like the breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great views”
Reviews.Author: Batsamai
Reviews.Content: The plus for Somerset Liang court is the great location in Clarke Quay, the most vibey part of Singapore with great restaurants along the river. My family of 13 booked 3 two bedroom apartments and the accomodation was great. Clean rooms, fully equipped with the kitchenette and dining area. Worked well for a family with teenagers, nice and roomy. The rooms we got had great views of the city. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early to one of the rooms that was already free which helped a lot since we arrived in singapore at 7am. They gave good directions when we wanted to go places, they gave us a wheelchair for free for the duration of the stay as we had an injured family member with us. The other great thing was the free Wi-fi in the hotel and free internet on a computer at reception. The downside of thehotel is that they offer a very basic continental breakfast which makes sense given that it is more serviced apartments than a hotel. There is a 24hr McDonalds and shopping centre adjacent to the hotel which offered alternatives to the hotel breakfast. The hotel also has a large swimming pool which is great for cooling off after a long day. Singapore is hot and humid. Overall Singapore is a great place to visit, good metro system. The nearest MRT to the hotel is at Clarke Quay through the shopping centre "The Central" which is about 10 min walk. Otherwise the bus stop is just across the street from the hotel. The is also a taxi stop just outside the hotel and taxis in singapore are generally very affordable. Must visit places: Night Safari, Little India, Sentosa Island (we did not manage to get tickets to Universal Studios because of the peak season), Orchard Road, Mustafa's (24hr shop in Little India - perfumes go for a song!). Overall - we would go back to Somerset Liang Court.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice Serviced Residence”
Reviews.Author: gunawan_karnata8
Reviews.Content: This was my second time stayed in this residence. I am very satisfy with all services. And now KOPITIAM Food Court had already opened in Liang Court Buiiding besides the residence so now we have more choices to have lunch or dinner. Bus, Taxi or MRT just in minutes. Perfect. I will stay in this residence when I in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “A roomy apartment with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferpenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Somerset Liang Court for a week withour children aged 9 and 7. The two bedroom apartment was surprisingly large and had a great view over Clarke Quay and the new Marina Sands complex. The apartment is in an excellent location with a shopping centre with a delicious food court and supermarket right next door, and an MRT station 5 minutes away. But best of all is the pool, which was 20 metres long and never crowded. Exatly what yu need in Singspore after a hard days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you have a large family...”
Reviews.Author: wasimmehr
Reviews.Content: The apartments are reasonable sized and work well when you have a larger family of 4 or more, especially with children. The building is pretty old with some renovations to the rooms. Staff reasonably courteous. Pool pretty good. Breakfast was below average but acceptable for a free one. The location is good, close to MRT and Taxi stand, but not so good for shopping. Good and fast internet

Reviews.Title: “If you want a homely stay then you surely have to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Aashish_BLR
Reviews.Content: Somerset was the perfect home away from home. They had a very friendly staff. It was my mother's birthday and in the evening they sent a surprise birthday cake from the whole staff and wished my mother a very happy birthday! I was feeling so proud of choosing such a good hotel for our stay in Singapore. The fitness room, swimming pool ,spa and jacuzzi were clean. I would love to stay here everytime I visit Singapore. My children were not ready to go back after our trip was over. We all just simply loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ge01bar2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liang Court for 2 nights in a 2 bed/2 bathroom apartment with relatives and we loved it. Rooms were exceptionally clean and look to be well maintained. We were on the 18th floor and our room had a beautiful view of the city from both bedrooms and the living area. It was very easy to get around from here and was right next to the river and restaurant/bar area. I must say though that the breakfast was not too good. Very little selection and what there was, was mostly odd stuff that I would not eat at breakfast, for one example - crumbed onion rings!?!? Good coffee machine though and yummy sachets of cream cheese to put on your toast so if you dont usually have much anyway then you'll be fine. Anyway, the very friendly and helpful reception staff and great rooms more than make up for the not so good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat from the city.”
Reviews.Author: 4ECP
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable apartments. I believe they were recently refurbished - large comfortable beds, clean, well-equipped kitchen, good showers. In Singapore, what we really needed was somewhere to retreat to when we were too hot/tired to go out anywhere. The pool was wonderful because it is reasonably large (unlike some hotels) even if shared with the Novotel next door. Pool busiest in the late afternoon and weekend. But we had it all to ourselves some mornngs and after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: zozo71
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Singapore where we stayed for 4 nights with our 2 children aged 6 and 4. Our apartment was on the 22nd floor and had great views, spacious clean rooms and comfortable beds (king size in main room and twin singles for the children) It also had living/kitchen area. The pool is lovely, staff extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast was an added bonus. It was very well situated for supermarkets, restaurants, and MRT. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: travelerdkl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 14 nights with wife and 2 kids (3 & 6yo) in a 2 bedroom suite. Location is superb. Staff excellent. We booked a newly refurbished 2 BR Premier unit on the 21st floor and looked out of clark quay, river, city and bay and directly at the amazing marina bay sands complex - just superb views. I recommend the premier units to guarantee the view. Living are is small. main bedroom was extra large - could have used some of that space in the living room. 2BR is fine. Only downside was the clothes washer/drier in the kitchen which is very noisy and annoying when trying to relax with a movie after a day with hypo kids!! Kitchen also small but we were only preparing food for kids so we didn't care. Taxi ranks 2 mins walk away and never a problem. other taxi ranks at clark quay itself but on weekend nights they are hard to get. 7/11 1min walk. Cold storage supermarket 5 mins walk away. And japanese supermarket (which caters all western shopping also) just 10 mins walk. Good cheap asian restaurant downstairs for eat in or take out. Universal still not fully opened (in fact nothing has changed since I was there in May) but still a great day. The Mummy ride is worth it. As always, attractions in Singapore are plentiful such as Sentosa, Night Safari, zoo, bird park etc etc But finding some new ones this time such as Science Park which is fantastic for younger kids. Visited there just for a look and stayed 5 hours. Next door is snow world which is also fun but not a lot to do there besides one hill sled option. They supply the snow clothes free. Wet Wet wild waterpark is also great for kids. And the botanical gardens has a lot to offer once you start walking all around it. If staying at Somerset Liang Court, dont miss the kite flying at night....this is amazing to watch - and free! This is done in the park over the bridge - 5 mins walk and starts around 7.30pm. You cant do it yourself but its great and very colorful to watch at night. There is a workshop in the building next door which you can buy the kites etc and also sit for free and try your hand at simulators. its not easy! The location of this hotel puts you right on top of clark quay which is packed with restaurants and bars and has a great atmosphere. Some really lovely places to eat and drink beside the river. Dont miss the night show by the water on Sentosa - 7pm and 8pm shows. And the new Marina Bay Sands building is a must to go atop and walk around. You have free wireless internat to as a bonus and the speed is ok. had only 2 free breakfasts as its not a lot to get excited about but with the supermarkets so close, we stocked with food we liked. Highly recommend this apartment to anyone particuarly if you book a premier room.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: nzpc
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the somerset mostly due to the reviews we found on here & for that I thank all that took the time to submit a review it was a great help. Upon our arrival at 7am we were proptly checked in & sent to our room on the 16th floor. there was a greeting card & all the relevent information layed out on the dining table for us. We had booked a 2 bedroom excecutive suite. The rooms were clean, spacous & tidy. with two bathrooms, two balconies, & two flat screen TV's. It had a suffcient kitchen & dining/ lounge area for our family of 4. The staff from the front desk to the cleaners were excellent, friendly & helpful. on level 8 there is the breakfast area which is open from 6;30 until 10 on weekdays & 7 until 10:30 on the weekends. they had a good selection of food from scrambled eggs on some days to boiled eggs, hash browns, baked beans, pizza breads & other various pastries to name a few. along with tea / coffee & cereals etc. we ate there every morning as the varitety keeped us coming back. there did seem to be a rush on between 9 & 10 though & at times the place is full so you may have to wait 5 or 10 minutes for a table. the swimming pool was excellent approx 30 mtr pool & 3.5 meters deep at one end. It is shared with the novatel, but wasn't crowded at all & has resturant & bar facilities which you get 20% off food & drinks if you are staying at the somerset. there is also a supermarket in the liang mall that has all your needs as a family. There is some great local food to be had next to the supermarket. The location is great! a 100 meter walk from the lobby will have you at the singapore river with all the attractions that go with it on clarke quay. Robinson quay is also well served with bars & resturants just head right along the river bank instead of left when you hit the river. There is a well equiped gym & spa/sauna rooms on the 25th floor. they have free internet in the lobby which was very handy for us. On check out we were able to put our luggage in the luggage room until it was time to head to the airport & still use the pool facilities. so all in all a great place to stay in my view & value for money when comparing to simularly located accommodation. if you have any questions at all on singapore please don't hesitate to ask while it is still fresh in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well appointed apartments”
Reviews.Author: triptrick_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at Somerset Liang Court in a newly renovated 2 bedroom executive apartment. It was clean, was well equipped and the location was excellent. Round the corner from Clarke Quay, the best sushi just downstairs and a 5 minute walk to the MRT. Breakfast was included which was a real bonus and set us up for the day. Would definitely stay there again. To top it off, there was complimentary high speed internet!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: gunawan_karnata8
Reviews.Content: I have so many times come to Singapore and I always changes my accomodation when I come to Singapore, until I found this service apartements I will never change again. Very quite, clean, modern furniture and very competitive price with same level hotel. Easy to go anywhere Meals, supermarket, medical clinic, restaurants etc all around this apartement. I stayed for 4 nights in 2 rooms premier suites. I am very satisfied for the whole service. I will come again if I visiting Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “great location-good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ALOKJEE
Reviews.Content: stayed here last summer in a 2 bedroom apartment since price promotion was on-found it to be reasonable rooms are good sized,comfortable and linen is top class but if you need anything extra-the replenishment is unfriendly...service with a smile is somehow missing breakfast is a passe and it is better one cooks inside your own space with adequate utensils/cutlery provided location is good and clark quay-the most happening place is just a stroll away

Reviews.Title: “I had forgotten how good - good is..”
Reviews.Author: HowieT3
Reviews.Content: Stayed after having had extremely good advice from Julie Tan. From the very moment we arrived the staff were fantastic.. We were able to check in early..the room was very clean and an extra bed was provided immediately to the room as we have 3 children..Advice on trips and excursions was extremely helpful..The room was cleaned beautifully everyday and we cannot thank the staff enough for the late check out and allowing us to use the facilities..pool/gym through out the rest of the day before we boarded our late night flight.. If you are looking for a clean central Hotel/Apartment where the action is ..Somerset Linah\g Court is for you.. The breakfast is plentiful and sets you up for the day..my kids just love Singapore because of the friendly staff..Thanks to all... and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money, If you want more room you have found it Here”
Reviews.Author: parktravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 Nights in over Sat, Sun and Monday night. It was a wonderful stay nothing was ever a problem for the staff here. We stayed in a two bed premier room on 23rd floor. Very little noise invasion at this level, except when a loud car was screaming down the road and even then it was muffled. The roo we had had been renovated and had all you would need to stay and self cater if you so desired. The Pool facility's are shared with the Novotel next door but it is a nice pool well kept and always had plenty of lounges available when we went down. The hotel is located right on Clarke Quay and we had a easy walk to the MRT station at Clarke Quay. Beds were very comforatable and having two bed and two bath was nice for the time we stayed. Free WiFi a bonus and the breakfast was sufficient to start the day but don't expect it to be a highlight. We had great service from a Lady named Susie I think she was a head housekeeper of high up in that department. Enjoy your stay here you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Class”
Reviews.Author: John476
Reviews.Content: Booked this on hotelclub, but there was some problems with the booking. However, the hotel resolved this straight away and even upgraded us for free for our troubles. I must say that the premier room is first class and a pleasure to stay in. 3 A/C units, kitchens, living room space and LCD tvs, its a wonderful place to stay - even with the renovations that are occuring. Breakfast is provided as is free internet. And for those that are after the night life, Clarke Quay is just around the corner I can't rate this place high enough. The premier rooms are at least 4.5 stars, and even better than some other 5 stay places in Singapre (Marriott)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT APARTMENTS - CENTRAL LOCATION FOR CITY VISIT”
Reviews.Author: colinandkathdudley
Reviews.Content: Somerset Liang Court 17th to 21st March 2010 We selected these apartments for a short family break in Singapore based on the recommendations on this site. The bottom line is that we were not disappointed. The two bedroom apartment was excellent; spacious, clean, comfortable and conveniently located. The staff are polite and very helpful – more later. The inclusive breakfast, whilst not the 5star buffet that comes with the equivalent hotel, was more than adequate to start the day. If you are looking for good accommodation which is more flexible and spacious than a hotel room and good value for money, in what is an expensive city, these apartments should be high on your list. The apartments are located next to the NovoHotel and a matter of yards from to Clark Quay. It is central for public transport – Clark Quay is the nearest metro train station about 400/500 yards from the apartment. We considered taking the train from the airport but decided upon a taxi – which was reasonably priced. If you are travelling light then use the train but I wouldn’t want to haul heavy cases from the train station to the apartments. There are an abundance of bars and restaurants near to the apartments and taxis are cheap to try the wide variety of eating options this city offers. This was our second visit to Singapore and we knew alcoholic drinks are expensive compared to home. However, we arrived on St Patricks Day in time to join in the party at Mulligan’s bar on Clark Quay to find Guinness at a mere 12 Dollars a pint - £6 sterling and Tiger Beer isn’t far behind. AA must be struggling for members in this city! During our stay we did not self cater but there is a large supermarket in the basement of Liang Court, the shopping centre that adjoins the apartments. This can also be accessed via the apartment lifts to B2 which is the car part and walking up the ramp to the supermarket. We took the Hippo / Duck tour of the city – about 33 dollars for a two day pass which lasts 48 hours from the time of purchase. This is a hop on hop off bus with two different routes covering the city. The pass includes a boat trip from Clark Quay. The company operates several other sightseeing tours. We found these tours value for money – once you had been around for the full tour you can select the areas you want to explore on foot and use the bus to access them. As for eating we tried the local street food in China Town – avoiding the Bullfrog and Pigs intestines or at least I think we did. Anyway it was tasty, cheap and went well with the Tiger. We would recommend the STREET cafe/ restaurant next to the apartment (turn right and right again out of the apartment block) – access via Liang Court. It has a wide range of local food at reasonable prices. A visit to Lau Pa Sat – the hawker food court is a must with its vast array of food and eating options. We visited the Outback Steakhouse at Suntec City based on our visits to that chain in the USA – a standard fare even though the steaks did not match those of the US. Still, a pleasant meal and the obliging staff suitably embarrassed our son whose birthday it was with a rendition of Happy Birthday. Whilst on the subject of our son’s birthday we arrived back at the apartment to find the management presented our son with a birthday cake and card. A nice touch and greatly appreciated – you don’t see this kind of treatment in UK hotels, at least not the ones we have visited. We were recommended to visit the Swiss Hotel next to Raffles – the views of the city from the Bar/ Lounge on the 70 / 72 floor are stunning, especially at night. Being so close to Raffles you have to do the tourist thing and visit the Long Bar for a Singapore Sling. Yes they do throw the peanut shells on the floor and charge a mere 25 dollars a pop for the famous drink plus service charge. The new Universal Studios Park on Sentosa Island opened during our visit but we found that tickets had to be pre-booked and you could not get same day entry. No doubt when the initial novelty has worn off access on the same day will be as usual – but check before taking a taxi out there Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our four days in Singapore and have no hesitation in recommending these apartments – they would be our first choice on any future visit. From Singapore we travelled to Penang (Holiday Inn Batu Ferringi and Kuala Lumpur – Somerset Seri Bukit Ceylon – which apartments are equally impressive – see separate review

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to an expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dextertalk
Reviews.Content: The Somerset Liang Court was a very good choice for us - two couples. We booked a two-bedroom premiere apartment, which was perfect for our needs. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The location is superb - right on the Singapore River with access to restaurants, China Town, the subway and shopping. The breakfast is quite good and the apartment is serviced daily. Watch out for the washer/drier - it is tricky to work. Eating out in Singapore is always a great experience. While there, we also visited the Asian Civilization Museum (on the river), went to the horse races (lots of fun) and the Botanical Gardens, which has spectacular orchid gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Happychappies4
Reviews.Content: So pleased we chose this property to stay at. Excellect location and a very secure place to be with a family. Liang Court is the attached shopping mall with lots of speciality shops, small department store and supermarket. Lots of fast food eating places for the teenagers and restaurants for us. Apartment was very clean and comfortable with internet access. Cooking facilities came in very handy. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The property is being refurbished and the work is being done between 9am and 6pm. We didn't have a refurbished room, but honestly we couldn't complain about the condition of the apartment at all. Linen was crisp and beds extremely comfortable. Breakfast is served at the Residents Lounge. Selection is limited, but tasty and adequate. Location is a $4-$7 taxi ride or $1 per person bus ride away from the Orchard district . Clarke Quay restaurant district is about a 5minute walk with heaps of restaurants along the river. If you are booking Day Tours, then the pick up point will be from Novotel Clarke Quay which is around the corner . We are very happy we stayed at this location and would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value for Money. Nice Pool.”
Reviews.Author: fraser97
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 adults stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment in Nov 2009. Trying to find reasonably priced accommodation in Singapore is a challenge. For 2 room mid-range accommodation, Somerset proved value for money. We booked trough Agoda.com, which was cheaper than booking direct with Somerset (they told us so). Staff & Service friendly & efficient. Apartment clean, but a bit tired, though renovations were underway, so this should improve. Showers could benefit with a demoulding. Cooking facilities & washer/dryer a bonus. Pool a real plus: big, clean & plenty of shaded chairs and lounges. Breakfast was included in the price and was adequate (tea, coffee, juice, pastries, cereal, corn soup, eggs, toast). Excellent Location, next to Clark Quay and walking distance to MRT. For the price & location, it woud be difficult to beat. It served us well and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “check for renovation works”
Reviews.Author: Simla10
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days recently, all you would expect of an apartment in Singapore. But beware - major renovation works were happening in the day time, supposed to stop at 6pm but went on into the night. Check if this is still happening when you book.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: philljan
Reviews.Content: Had a brief stay in 2 bed 2 bath apartment on way back from KL. Apartment space and facilities were good especially a washer/dryer. The view we had from balcony was excellent. If you want to stay around Clarke Quay this is a reasonably priced place to stay with adequate breakfast. Apartment certainly gives more space than a hotel room. Place undergoing refurbishment which will make these apartments more appealing. Pool area very spacious. Had previously stayed nearer to Orchard Road which to me was preferred location but Hop on -off bus stops outside, short walk to MRT station, bum boats rides just at the river and plenty of nightlife and restaurants around Clarke Quay that are operating every night. So recommend if you want to stay in this location

Reviews.Title: “Great location - spacy appartments”
Reviews.Author: TigiCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Our family had 2 two-bedroom appartments. They were nice and spacy with washingmachine and dishwasher. The view over Singapores habour was great and ther was a balcony. The hotel has a nice big pool, good fitness-center and good brekfast. The hotel i located near the river with lots of restaurants close by. Free - but slow - internet in the rooms. The reception was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy and clean”
Reviews.Author: Hansje
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last three days of our holiday here. One night in a deluxe and 3 nights in an executive apartment. The deluxe apartment has a double and a ingle bedroom, the executive a double and a twin, so we had to improvise a bit the first night (BTW we booked an extra night, but the execs were sold out). Both apartment types are roomy, the exec a bit more than deluxe. Location is good, near the restaurants at the quais and on top of a japanese oriented shopping center. If the japanese supermarket is too expensive, then there are other ones nearby. The swimming pool that it shares wiith the novotel is large (and deep!) and you get 20 % discount on your novotel restaurant bills. Fun to do: make your own pewter disk at the Selangor School of hard knocks nearby. Have a beer at the microbrewery "Brewerkz, also around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, generous living accomodation”
Reviews.Author: TheWarbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 11th to 20th August 2009. Could not believe the size of the apartment. Kitchen and washing machine a great help when travelling with teenagers who always want to wear the same t-shirt!! Rooms were clean, housekeeping very good. Great location on the side of Clarke Quay and close to china town and Bugis. Lots of places to eat and easy access to MRT and buses. Reception staff always welcome you back. Breakfast was a little strange kids did not like it very much but once you get used to soup for breakfast it was fine, could do with more tables and chairs as it did become crowded. Building work was taking place but only during the day so if you are out all day like we were then it does not affect you. Pool was lovely lots of sunbeds and towels were soft and clean. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Serviced Apartments in trendy precinct”
Reviews.Author: planz78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liang Court for 7 days, in a two bedroom apartment with balcony views over the southern districts (including the awesome Golden Sands Casino construction site). Location was very convenient to walk to Clarke Quay MRT station, take one of two bridges across the river, 10 minutes at a leisurely stroll. Chinatown precinct is within walking distance. Clarke Quay is lined with many trendy restaurants and bars (nightclubs), and obviously a popular venue for youth come weekends. Noise was never an issue. Somerset Liang Court has a breakfast bar included in some packages, with a simple selection of toast, cereals, pastries and a different hot dish every morning. The staff were some of the friendliest people we met during our stay. Traveling at the peak of H1N1 concerns, we were precautiously quarantined at the children's hospital on our final day. The staff arranged for our luggage to be forwarded to the hospital quicker than if we had done it ourselves. I even received a phone call from the front desk, once back home to ask if everything was OK with our son, and that some staff had even considered coming to visit us at the hospital if we had been forced to stay overnight. See you next time Somerset Liang Court.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families/ couples travelling together....”
Reviews.Author: travelbugchris
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with everything Tam Carr wrote., except the breakfast- which I thought had a lot of choice, porridge, toast, ceral, different pasteries, fruit, eggs, yogurt and lots more. We got a bargain on wotif, $188 (Aus) for a night, we stayed for 7 nights and thought our choice was fantastic as we travelled with a toddler. There is a small shopping mall (liang court) with supermarket right next door, the mall has quite a number of places to eat, and there is Clarke Quay eateries on your doorstep!!!! The shopping mall had a taxi rank right near the Somerset, and on the other side of the mall there is a free shuttle bus to a few places. Also the liang court mall had a Children's play gym - Royce's Play Gyms (?) - It was fantastic - air- con, SUPER super clean. The Clarke Quay MRT is close by too - but we just used the taxi as they were cheap enough - only $17 to get to airport and I think it was less than that to get to the zoo. Never had to wait for a taxi - they are already lined up. The staff are pleasant and helpful - and they loved kids. The apartment was bigger than I expected heaps of room for little ones. The only issue we had was the toilet in the main bathroom was leaking - it was promptly attended to. Oh and there was an issue with our late checkout fee, but once I contacted the Somerset reservations this was promptly cleared up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and good value”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose a serviced apartment rather than a hotel as it was a cheaper option than 2 double rooms. We were 2 adult couples and Somerset Liang Court was perfect for our needs in every respect. The location immediately next to Clarke Quay is great and with all those bars / restaurants and also a shopping mall on your doorstep it was a perfect base. The apartment was fitted with all the items we needed and more. The washing machine was ideal for catching up with all the dirty laundry that had accumulated over our travels. The small kitchen was housed with oven, hob and microwave too. Wi-fi Internet was available in the apartment at a charge but was free to use in the Residents lounge on the 8th floor. This was also where we ate breakfast. Cable TV channels included all the usual popular ones and a dvd player was also there. The rooms were all spacious and the master bedroom was ensuite. Bedroom 2 was adjacent to the second bathroom / toilet. Cleanliness was very good as was the air-con. Breakfast was very basic but enough to get you going in the morning and keep you going until lunchtime. The Somerset Liang Court shares a swimming pool with the Novotel next door and towels and drinks / snack service is availabel poolside. We would definitely recommend this place as a more relaxing place to stay than a hotel room and especially for families or 2 couples. We will use it again.
